results.title: [Effect of lisinopril on cardiac parameters and mortality after myocardial infarction in rats].
results.text_hl: PURPOSE: To analyse the effect of early (< 24h) administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@ventricular remodeling@@@ and mortality after @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ (MI) in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and clinical efficacy in the early management of acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: The ability of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ to attenuate the detrimental effects of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@left ventricular remodelling@@@ is a key mechanism; however, additional cardioprotective and vasculoprotective actions are postulated to play a role in mediating the early benefit.

citations.NLM: Goa KL, Balfour JA, Zuanetti G. Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and clinical efficacy in the early management of acute myocardial infarction. Drugs. 1996 Oct;52(4):564-88. PMID: 8891468

results.title: Cardiac Remodeling and Reversible Pulmonary Hypertension During Pneumonitis in Rats after 13-Gy Partial-Body Irradiation with Minimal Bone Marrow Sparing: Effect of Lisinopril.
results.text_hl: Irradiated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ given @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ showed no increase in pulmonary artery pressures at 50 d but exhibited left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@ventricular remodeling@@@.

citations.NLM: Jacobs ER, Narayanan J, Fish BL, Gao F, Harmann LM, Bergom C, Gasperetti T, Strande JL, Medhora M. Cardiac Remodeling and Reversible Pulmonary Hypertension During Pneumonitis in Rats after 13-Gy Partial-Body Irradiation with Minimal Bone Marrow Sparing: Effect of Lisinopril. results.title: [Evaluation of long-term therapy influence with angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril on morphofunctional parameters of the left ventricle, peripheral artery endothelium disfunction and painless myocardial ischemia in premenopausal women with hypertension].
results.text_hl: The results show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy in premenopausal @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ can stop or even cause regression of @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@LV myocardial hypertrophy@@@ and produce favorable effect on @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@LV remodeling@@@ mostly in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with concentric type of @DISEASE_Hypertrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D006984 @@@hypertrophy@@@ and/or without @DISEASE_Vascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014652 @@@endothelial dysfunction@@@, and has positive effect on frequency of painless @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@myocardial ischemia@@@ events.

citations.NLM: Khabibulina MM. [Evaluation of long-term therapy influence with angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril on morphofunctional parameters of the left ventricle, peripheral artery endothelium disfunction and painless myocardial ischemia in premenopausal women with hypertension]. Kardiologiia. 2010;50(1):16-21. PMID: 20144153

results.title: Cardiovascular critical event pathways for the progression of heart failure; a report from the ATLAS study.
results.text_hl: A reduction in vascular events, as well as benefits on @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@ventricular remodelling@@@, could account for the decrease in @DISEASE_Death @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ or hospitalization with high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Cleland JG, Thygesen K, Uretsky BF, Armstrong P, Horowitz JD, Massie B, Packer M, Poole-Wilson PA, Rydén L, ATLAS investigators. Cardiovascular critical event pathways for the progression of heart failure; a report from the ATLAS study. Eur Heart J. 2001 Sep;22(17):1601-12. PMID: 11492990

results.title: Advanced hypertensive heart disease in spontaneously hypertensive rats. Lisinopril-mediated regression of myocardial fibrosis.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@systolic dysfunction of the left ventricle@@@ could be prevented.
